result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Activity:Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:34 PM Defendant William C. Buchanan in court by video in custody with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz by video.  Emmeline Lee appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Cash bond of $250 set with conditions of curfew from 7pm to 7am unless traveling to or from work.   Court orders Level 3 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Justice Point: Rock County Pretrial Risk Report
Court orders Level 3 supervision through JusticePoint.  Must contact JusticePoint within 24 hours of release from custody. Curfew from 7pm to 7am unless at work or traveling to and from work.
